differences.gitbook: Tuso and Gorga suggested the creation of bots to welcome new members into program and guide them to e.g. the Getting Started channel.
differences.supabase: Tuso and Gorga suggested the creation of bots to welcome new members into program and guide them to e.g. the Getting Started channel

differences.gitbook: LadyTempestt suggested that onboarding WG members could attend different Workgroups' meetings to invite members to our onboarding sessions.
differences.supabase: LadyTempestt suggested that onboarding WG members could attend different Workgroups' meetings to invite members to our onboarding sessions

differences.gitbook: Vani suggested that we could post in the introductions channel to encourage people that are interested in the ambassador program.
differences.supabase: Vani suggested that we could post in the introductions channel to encourage people that are interested in the ambassador program

differences.gitbook: We discussed idea of colour-coding people's names on Discord to show their roles: but we noted that most people are part of many groups and have many roles , so it wouldn't really work, and our current WG tags already serve this function.
differences.supabase: We discussed idea of colour-coding people's names on Discord to show their roles: but we noted that most people are part of many groups and have many roles , so it wouldn't really work, and our current WG tags already serve this function

differences.gitbook: A hierarchy or system of levels in Discord was suggested, but several people questioned how this would be valid given our non-hierarchical ecosystem. Also questioned how someone's "level" would be determined (manually, and if so, by whom? or automated?) and on what basis (Time? Number of posts? A combination?).
differences.supabase: A hierarchy or system of levels in Discord was suggested, but several people questioned how this would be valid given our non-hierarchical ecosystem. Also questioned how someone's "level" would be determined (manually, and if so, by whom? or automated?) and on what basis (Time? Number of posts? A combination?)

differences.gitbook: We also noted that if a new person posts to say hi, we welcome them - but if they don't - perhaps by being too shy - we can easily miss them.
differences.supabase: We also noted that if a new person posts to say hi, we welcome them - but if they don't - perhaps by being too shy - we can easily miss them
